properties.name: American River Parkway
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish At the end of Arden Way, the American River Parkway nature area is easily accessible. For a small fee, there\'s a nice little parking lot to keep your car in that puts you right on the Jedediah Smith Rec. Trail. Theoretically, you could also park your car on a neighborhood street just a little farther away... Not that I\'m suggesting that. Anyway, this may be the best place for Sacramento area birdwatching that I\'ve been to. The river is beautiful, and depending on the season, you can sometimes travel on foot to wooded juts of land that are islands much of the time. This is also a good place for native plant study. In the evening, this place is thick with deer. You may even see the occasional coyote.

properties.name: Andy Nguyen's
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  2007 Broadway, Sacramento, CA 95818 Delicious Vietnamese food. All dishes here are vegetarian and most are vegan. They serve lots of faux meat. I absolutely love the nori "fish"! The atmosphere is very pleasant and relaxing, too.

properties.name: Azna Gluten Free Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 2647 Cameron Park Drive Cameron Park, CA 95682Gluten-free, vegan, all-natural baked goods. I\'m planning on visiting this place soon. But I sampled some of their \'Baby Bites\' mini cinnamon rolls at the Whole Earth festival in Davis a while back and they were SO good!

properties.name: Bipartisan Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   7901 SE Stark Street, PortlandA place for homemade pie!

properties.name: Boba Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  5131 Freeport Blvd. Sacramento, CA 95822Apparently this was once called "Tapioca Express". It might be under different ownership now. Anyway, this place is awesome! Wonderful boba. Wonderful food. Cheap prices. Friendly, comfortable atmosphere. You really can\'t lose here. I got the red bean soy milk with added red beans and large boba. Best boba drink I\'ve ever had, hands down! It was blended smooth with ice and sweetened to perfection! The boba were chewy and sweet, just like they should be. Also got the almond soy milk with boba... not my favorite. The artificial almond flavor didn\'t sit well with me. I got some food while I was there, too. Luckily, there were plenty of vegan options for me. The sea weed salad with bean sprouts in garlic and vinegar sauce: fantastic! And the dry bean curd (slightly stinky tofu) with Chinese parsley (a.k.a. cilantro) and peanut? Ditto! This was authentic, quality Asian food, not deep fried crap catered to American tastes. I can\'t wait to eat there again!

properties.name: Capital Stage Theater Company
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 1000 Front Street Sacramento, CA 95814I love going to see plays here! The theater is aboard the Delta King river boat in Old Sacramento. The shows are surprisingly inexpensive for the high quality of the performances. (A subscription will let you see three shows for 36 dollars.) I\'ve seen at least a dozen plays here. Two recent shows, "First Person Shooter" and "The Scene", blew me away particularly. The "Playwrights\' Revolution" program is awesome and helps emerging playwrights get their work performed. This venue is wonderful!

properties.name: Caswell Memorial State Park
properties.description: Posted by Baobot  28000 South Austin Road, Ripon, CA, United StatesThe park is located along the Stanislaus River near the town of Ripon, California. The park protects a fine example of the threatened and still declining riparian oak woodland, which once flourished throughout California\'s Central Valley. Caswell is home to several endangered animal species, including the riparian brush rabbit which is not known to occur anywhere else. The Native Americans who lived along this river and collected acorns among these ancient groves were Yokuts. In the early 1800s, Spanish explorers traversed this area, and fur trappers found the river bountiful. Thomas Caswell, landowner, enjoyed this wonderful forest and felt it should be preserved. In 1950 the children and grand children donated 134 acres to the people of California. Additional donations and state purchases brought Caswell to its current size of 258 acres. Caswell Memorial State Park was open to the public in 1958.

properties.name: Ciao! Bella!! Italian Restaurant and Cabaret
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish     9217 Highway 9, Ben Lomond CAIf you feel like delicious Italian food and unique entertainment, this is the place to go. If you aren\'t squeamish, that is. Think Rocky Horror picture show, waitresses singing opera, bumper stickers covering the walls, and being greeted by the owner and his guitar from the chair nailed to the roof. Certainly an experience. And be warned: if it is your birthday, the owner may spank you.

properties.name: Coyote Hills Regional Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 8000 Patterson Ranch Road Fremont, CA 94555This park is gorgeous! It contains nearly 978 acres of wetlands and rolling hills. There\'s a boardwalk near the visitors\' center that lets you walk through some of the wetlands. This is an unbeatable place for birdwatching! The visitors\' center has a small but very nice museum in it. Many exhibits focus on the Ohlone tribe, who inhabited the land prior to European invasion.

properties.name: Crater Lake National Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  From the National Park Service website: "Crater Lake is located in Southern Oregon on the crest of the Cascade Mountain range, 100 miles (160 km) east of the Pacific Ocean. It lies inside a caldera, or volcanic basin, created when the 12,000 foot (3,660 meter) high Mount Mazama collapsed 7,700 years ago following a large eruption. "Generous amounts of winter snow, averaging 533 inches (1,354 cm) per year, supply the lake with water. There are no inlets or outlets to the lake. Crater Lake, at 1,943 feet (592 meters) deep, is the seventh deepest lake in the world and the deepest in the United States. Evaporation and seepage prevent the lake from becoming any deeper."

properties.name: Crest Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish    1013 K Street Sacramento, CA 95814The Crest is one of several historic movie theaters in Sacramento. This venue also frequently hosts concerts, lectures, and other live events since the individual theaters within are very big and can accommodate that sort of thing. Films shown in this place are generally the artsy indie type. I love going to movies here because the ticket prices are actually less expensive than any of the regular corporate theaters nearby. Totally awesome! The Crest Cafe is right next door. (I\'ve never tried it.)

properties.name: Emma's Tamales & Mother Earth's Natural Foods
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 8101 Elder Creek Rd - Unit P, Sacramento, Ca 95824Vegan tamales available here. From their website: "Emma\'s Tamales contain only expeller pressed canola oil (NO LARD) and 50% organic corn masa. Taste the clean difference! Chicken is skinless thigh meat, beans are organic, Tofu organic we will always choose organic produce for our products when it is within our cost effectiveness range. produce is always thoroughly rinsed before use."

properties.name: Faces Nightclub
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   2000 K Street, Sacramento, CA 95814Sacramento\'s longest running night club and gay bar. From their Myspace page: "Faces was voted #1 nightclub in Sacramento for 2008! Faces offers a variety of music on three separate dance floors. On the second floor you will discover a great view from our circular balcony as well as several additional bars and the VIP lounge. Faces has 15 bar stations so you never have to wait for your drinks! On Sundays the pool is open for swimming and offers a fantastic area to socialize and meet new friends. It\'s a great place to come and relax and be yourself without judgment! Faces is a club everyone can enjoy. Come check us out."

properties.name: Folsom Lake Rec. Area access- Main & Sunset
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  At the intersection of Main and Sunset Avenues, there is ample space off the side of the road for several vehicles to park, free of charge. From here, there is access to several paved and unpaved trails that head to Lake Natoma and Nimbus Dam.

properties.name: Food Fight! Vegan Grocery
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  1217 SE Stark St., Portland, ORI want to visit this place so much!

properties.name: Gallo Center for the Arts
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  1000 I Street Modesto, CA 95354From their site: "Gallo Center for the Arts is a non-profit performing arts center with a deep commitment to enriching the people and communities of California’s vast Central Valley. From the scintillating performances of our wonderful resident companies, to the great variety of world-class entertainment presented by the Center each season, to the robust arts education programs for our region’s youth, this is where magic happens."

properties.name: Giant Metal Chicken
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   5431 Hazel Ave, Sacramento, CAThis giant, blindingly shiny chicken is in front of a Safeway store. It is just one of many large chrome creatures made of car bumpers by Denver artist Sean Guerrero. Guerrero\'s creations are well favored by local developer Paul Petrovich who thinks that the giant recycled-chrome animal series is "...so cool. They\'re so over the top."

properties.name: Giant Metal Horse
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   1814 19th St Sacramento, CA 95814This huge, blindingly shiny horse is in front of a Safeway store. It is just one of many large chrome creatures fashioned from car bumpers by Denver artist Sean Guerrero. Guerrero\'s creations are well favored by local developer Paul Petrovich who thinks that the giant recycled-chrome animal series is "...so cool. They\'re so over the top." The horse could also be called something of a death steed to the artwork of Kevin Price, whose soulful music-themed mural existed in the same vicinity for just a couple of years before being destroyed when Petrovich obtained the property. This may have been in violation of federal law, as Price was not notified and was given no chance to preserve his work.

properties.name: Gluten Free Specialty Market
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  2612 J Street, Suite #1 Sacramento CA, 95816This is a really nice, friendly little independent store. All items in stock are gluten free and made with natural ingredients. Also a great place to get vegan snacks! If you\'re interested in supporting local independent shops, give this place a try! I\'ve been there once so far and plan to return.

properties.name: Gorilla Food
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 101 - 436 Richards St. Vancouver, BC, Canada V6B 2Z4From their website: "We are passionate about creatively and consciously providing raw, organic, vegan, live foods to people who care for themselves and the world we live in!"

properties.name: Grocery Outlet Bargain Market- Folsom
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  671 E. Bidwell St. Folsom,CA 95630Every Grocery Outlet has different merchandise, but this one is especially good for toiletries. My girlfriend and I got some of that JASON natural shampoo and conditioner here at about half the price it sells for at Raley\'s/ Bel Air. There was also a good variety of all natural lotions for cheap.

properties.name: Grocery Outlet Bargain Market- Granite Bay
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  4080 Douglas Blvd Granite Bay,CA 95746Every Grocery Outlet has different merchandise, but this one is especially good for food shopping. My girlfriend and I got a ton of \'SunSpire\' vegan chocolate bars and a bunch of \'SO Delicious\' vegan ice cream at this store. I had a sugar rush for days. Thankfully, the store has consistently had both these items in stock. I don\'t know how I\'d get my fix if I had to pay the prices Whole Foods asks for the same stuff.

properties.name: Grocery Outlet Bargain Market- West Sac
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  845 HARBOR BLVD. WEST SACRAMENTO,CA 95691Every Grocery Outlet has different merchandise, but this one is especially good for food shopping. One time my girlfriend and I got literally about 20 Clif bars there because they were only 59 cents a pop. There was also a huge jar of this amazing all-natural artichoke tapenade that we got there for super-cheap. Unfortunately, we haven\'t seen it since. If we did, I would buy about 10 jars of it. But I guess the unpredictability is a necessary part of the thrill of bargain shopping.

properties.name: Hillside Quickie's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 324 15th Ave E. Seattle WA 98112

properties.name: Hillside Quickies Vegan Sandwich Shop
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 4106 Brooklyn Ave, Seattle WA 98105Must visit!

properties.name: Hostel Obispo
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 1617 Santa Rosa St. San Luis Obispo, CA 93401I stayed a night at this place in spring 2009. Loved it! The staff were ultra-friendly, and the atmosphere was clean, cozy, and inviting. I\'ll absolutely stay again the next time I find myself in SLO!

properties.name: Lava Beds National Monument
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  The lava tubes here make for some great amateur spelunking! If you\'re not worried about looking nerdy, you might want to bring a hard hat. I had one and was glad of it. The ceilings within the caves get very low and some parts will need to be crawled through. The hiking here is great, but bring sun protection. This site is also home to carved petroglyphs and painted pictographs left by native peoples. The majority of these are located at what is now called Petroglyph Point. (I\'m quite sad because I didn\'t know about the rock art when I was visiting here and I didn\'t see it... Guess I\'ll have to go back now!) The native Modoc people used their knowledge of these caves to help them fight off the US army during the Modoc War of 1872-1873.

properties.name: McArthur-Burney Falls Memorial State Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  While the hiking here is great (the park is on the Pacific Crest Trail), the main reason to visit this park is Burney Falls. At 129 feet, they\'re certainly not the biggest falls around, but take my word for it, they are spectacularly beautiful. A word of advice about vacationing here, though. I have yet to try camping in this area, but I\'m guessing that it would be a far superior experience to lodging in the nearby town of Fall River Mills. The only place to shop for food was a tiny convenience store, and the only restaurant in town was a nightmare. If you\'re intent on staying at a motel, the town of Burney might be a better bet- it at least has a Safeway.

properties.name: Montana de Oro State Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  From the California State Parks website: "This park features rugged cliffs, secluded sandy beaches, coastal plains, streams, canyons, and hills, including 1,347-foot Valencia Peak. Naturalists and backpackers enjoy the solitude and freedom found along the park’s trails. There are also mountain biking and equestrian trails. The best-known beach is Spooner’s Cove, across from the campground. The park’s name, "Mountain of Gold," comes from the golden wildflowers that bloom in spring. Wildlife in the park includes black tailed deer and the black oystercatcher. The park includes primitive and equestrian campsites."

properties.name: Mt. Baker-Snoqualmie National Forest
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  From the U.S. Forest Service site: "Welcome to the Mt. Baker-Snoqualmie National Forest, one of the most visited forests in the country, located on the western slopes of the Cascade mountain range between Seattle, Washington and Vancouver, British Columbia. Here you will find glacier-covered peaks, spectacular mountain meadows and old-growth forests."

properties.name: Mt. Rainier National Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  From wikipedia: "Mount Rainier National Park is a United States National Park located in southeast Pierce County and northeast Lewis County in Washington state.[1] It was established on 2 March 1899, the fifth national park in the United States. The park contains 368 square miles (950 km2) including all of Mount Rainier, a 14,410-foot (4,392 m) stratovolcano.[2] The mountain rises abruptly from the surrounding land with elevations in the park ranging from 1,600 feet (490 m) to over 14,000 feet (4,300 m). The highest point in the Cascade Range, around it are valleys, waterfalls, subalpine wildflower meadows, old growth forest and more than 26 glaciers. The volcano is often shrouded in clouds that dump enormous amounts of rain and snow on the peak every year and hide it from the crowds that head to the park on weekends." http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mount_Rainier_National_Park

properties.name: Olympic National Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  From wikipedia: "Olympic National Park is located in the U.S. state of Washington, in the Olympic Peninsula. The park can be divided into three basic regions: the Pacific coastline, the Olympic Mountains, and the temperate rainforest. U.S. President Theodore Roosevelt originally created Olympic National Monument in 1909 and after Congress voted to authorize a redesignation to National Park status, President Franklin Roosevelt signed the legislation in 1938. In 1976, Olympic National Park became an International Biosphere Reserve, and in 1981 it was designated a World Heritage Site. In 1988, almost all of the Olympic Peninsula was designated as the Olympic Wilderness, further enhancing the protection of the region." http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Olympic_National_Park

properties.name: Orangevale Park
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  This park contains a playground, soccer fields, frisbee golf facilities, two horse arenas, and (best of all, in my opinion) a small but relatively intact example of riparian oak forest. The woods are a great place to go for a walk. The park is also the site of Orangevale\'s annual Spring carnival, "Pow Wow Days".

properties.name: Phoenix Park and Vernal Pools
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   9050 Sunset Ave Fair Oaks, CA 95628 Park amenities include soccer fields, picnic area, little league fields, multipurpose fields, a community garden, and a dog park. The best feature of the park is the vernal pools. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vernal_pool Unfortunately, the natural area is small and is surrounded by housing developments, but it\'s still ecologically interesting. The pools are a habitat for fairy shrimp and are a good place to go birdwatching. The best time to go is in April and May when the wildflowers are in bloom.

properties.name: Pie lovers unite
properties.description: Posted by Jason 7901 SE Stark St., Portland, ORAll kinds of vegan, gluten free, and traditional pies! Great coffee alongside makes this a real twin peaks favorite.

properties.name: Pizza Pi (100% Vegan Pizzeria)
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 5500 University Way NE, Seattle, Washington 98105From their website: "We are 100% VEGAN which means we use no animal products in anything we make. We use only the freshest ingredients. Gluten Free Dough available on select items."

properties.name: Planet Smoothie
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 1001 E Bidwell St Ste 105 Folsom, CA 95630This place is really great, better than Jamba Juice! The smoothies are thick and fruity, just as they should be. Last time I got a \'Thelma and Louise\', which is strawberries, pineapple, and a "women\'s only blast". So good! The menu has really convenient indicators next to the non-dairy items.There are brochures at the store that tell you what the nutritional contents of each drink are and what the contents of all the "Blasts" are. I don\'t think you can mix and match them like you can with the "Boosts" at Jamba Juice, but I personally don\'t mind. Some of the drinks with special ingredients are overly pricey, but most of the menu is very reasonable. Also, this location carries Sun Flour Baking Company vegan cookies, which was a total plus for me because those things are delicious!

properties.name: Prime Supermarket
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  4408 Del Rio Rd Sacramento, CA 95822A pretty large Asian market. This is a great place to get ethnic dry goods like spices, besan and other less common flours, agar agar, etcetera. I\'ve never bought produce from here because none of it has ever looked good to me (i.e. not very fresh). But the prices on goods that I do want to buy are great and definitely make the store worth visiting.

properties.name: Quickie Too
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 1324 So Martin Luther King Jr Way Tacoma, WA 98405

properties.name: Rainbow Grocery Food Co-op
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  1745 Folsom St San Francisco, CA 94103From their website: "We have been in San Francisco\'s Mission District since 1975. We strive to offer resources, education and a forum for informational exchange for many local communities and organizations. "Our goals include, but are not limited to: * "Providing affordable vegetarian food products which have minimal negative impact ecologically and socially * "Buying goods from local organic farmers, collectives, bakers, dairies and other local businesses whenever possible * "Providing our customers with the best possible service * "Providing Rainbow Grocery Cooperative\'s workers with a livable wage * "Creating a nonhierarchical work space based upon respect, mutuality and cooperation *" Offering low-cost health care products and resources"

properties.name: Raw Vegan Source
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  22336 NE 85th. Street, Redmond, WA 98053

properties.name: S & S Organic Produce and Natural Foods
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  1924 Mangrove Ave, Chico, CA 95926A very nice natural foods store with a great selection. It\'s bigger than it looks from the outside. For those who aren\'t vegetarian or vegan, they grind and season their own sausages. The prices aren\'t mega-corp cheap or anything, but they\'re perfectly reasonable for an indie market. I\'ve shopped there several times while visiting Chico and definitely recommend it.

properties.name: Sacramento Hostel
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 925 H Street Sacramento, CA 95814 From their site: "The Sacramento Hostel is housed in a beautiful 19th century mansion, one of the few surviving Gold Rush-era buildings on Sacramento’s Merchant Row. A restored grand entry, vaulted ceilings, wood paneling, chandeliers, stained glass skylight, and fireplaces with original hand-painted tiles all add to the historic appeal of this uniquely refined hostel."

properties.name: Sacramento Natural Foods Co-op
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  1900 Alhambra boulevard Sacramento, CA 95816Anyone can shop at this co-op regardless of membership. This place houses a spectacular selection of all-natural groceries, and its profits help support some wonderful charitable programs. Their seasonal produce is fantastic. The best avocados I have ever eaten were purchased from here. It has an awesome deli buffet (with plenty of vegetarian and vegan options) and a room with tables where you can sit and eat. The olive bar is fantastic. If you\'re a foodie and you\'re anywhere near Sacto, don\'t miss this place!

properties.name: Sunflower Drive In
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 10344 Fair Oaks Blvd Fair Oaks, CA 95628Oh, Sunflower, how I love you! This place serves all-natural vegetarian food with lots of vegan options. You walk up to the window, give your order, then sit at a picnic table to wait while chickens roam all around you. The service is kind of slow, so be prepared to wait a bit, but once they call your number.... Yum! The nut-burgers are fantastic. They also sell absolutely fabulous vegan cookies from Sacramento\'s Sun Flour Baking Company (website below). Talk about heavenly! http://www.sunflourbaking.com/index.html

properties.name: Tower Theatre
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish   2508 Land Park Drive Sacramento, CA 95818This small independent theater opened in 1938 and is, according to their website, "dedicated to bringing the finest in independent, foreign and specialty film to Sacramento\'s film lovers". I love this place. The theaters are small, intimate, and full of character. I love everything from the uneven floors to the bizarrely tall appearance of the rooms. The Tower Cafe is right next door. The atmosphere is fantastic, making it a great place to just sit and have a drink, if nothing else. Sweet pastries seem to be one of their speacialties. Apparently the french toast is marvelous, but I\'ve never tried it. The theater could be in trouble if too many new movie screens open downtown. If you\'re a Sac area film lover, please give this place your business and visit http://www.savethetowertheatre.org/index.html

properties.name: Vegan Garden Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish 1226. S. Jackson St., Seattle WA 98144Asian-inspired vegan food. Desserts, too!

properties.name: Ziggurat Building
properties.description: Posted by Carpfish  707 3rd Street West Sacramento, CA 95605This building is on the banks of the Sacramento river. There are nearby trails, trees, and places to fish. Facts from Emporis.com about the building: - "The terraced pyramid-shaped office building on the west side of Sacramento River in West Sacramento, overlooks Old Sacramento and the Tower Bridge." - "The Exterior is clad in Minnesota limestone and a high performance glass which has a special beige dot matrix coating that matches the color of the limestone." - "The 4-story high atrium ceiling is domed and features intricate detail work and exquisite painting creating an illusion of openness." - "The project cost 0 million and opened spring, 1998." - "The entire building was designed in accordance with the traditional rules of the Chinese philosophy of Feng Shui." - "The Ziggurat was The Money Store Western Headquarters before before the Company\'s collapse." - "One of the first new buildings in the United States to use Seismic Dampers." - "Ground floor footprint is 300x300 ft. with 10 ft. setbacks at each story to uppermost floor at 90x120 ft."
